metadata.title: CVE-2017-15908 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In systemd 223 through 235, a remote DNS server can respond with a customcrafted DNS NSEC resource record to trigger an infinite loop in thedns_packet_read_type_window() function of the 'systemd-resolved' serviceand cause a DoS of the affected service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15908` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.1
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.1
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.1
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.1').
